page.title: 07WORKERS' DAY AT MILLBRIDGE.
page.content:
The workers at the school are very busy each day. They start work at 7.3O a.m. checking that all the horses are safe and well after the night. They feed them at 8.3O a.m., and then 'muck out' the stables and groom the horses until the horses are next fed at I2.3O p.m. The afternoon would be spent exercising the horses over the surrounding hills or along the country roads, followed by another grooming.
The horses are fed again at IO.OO p.m.This is a normal days work. The routine changes on a Friday, when there are no rides, and when the workers prepare and plan the next day's riding lessons; on Saturday itself; and on the days when the handicapped come for their lessons.
